newsitem.title: INDIA: INDIAN HEADLINE STOCKS - factors to watch-March 25.
newsitem.headline: INDIAN HEADLINE STOCKS - factors to watch-March 25.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors affecting Indian stock markets on Tuesday morning:
** India's Videsh Sanchar Nigam Ltd (VSNL) said on Monday its global depositary receipt (GDR) issue had been priced at $13.93 per GDR, or 1,000 rupees per VSNL share.

It said in a statement the issue had been oversubscribed about 10 times. The price represents a 1.5 percent premium to VSNL's closing price of March 21 and each GDR represents half an ordinary VSNL share.
Gross proceeds from the offering, excluding an over-allotment option, amount to $448 million, making it India's largest international equity issue to date.
** India's Reliance Industries on Monday said it had commissioned a new petrochemical cracker with an ethylene production capacity of 750,000 tonnes annually.
"RIL's (Reliance Industries Ltd) cracker is the only world scale ethylene plant in India," the firm said in a statement.
"It has the largest naphtha cracking capacity in Asia and is the first to be commissioned during the last 20 years in the country," it added.
** Volatile Indian stock markets are expected to stabilise this week as fiscal year-end dampeners give way to renewed hope, but fresh demand will be slow, brokers said.
The Bombay Stock Exchange's top-30 share index finished 15.11 points, or 0.40 percent, off at 3,730.20 last week after dipping to 3,689.07.
Indian stock markets were closed on Monday due to a Hindu festival.
** The Indian rupee opened at 35.8750/8850 against the dollar on Tuesday, compared to the previous close on Friday of 35.885/890, dealers said.
Monday was a banking holiday for the Hindu festival.
Tuesday's range is seen at 35.87/90 rupees to a dollar, dealers said.
